required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pain Management for Cystoscopy: A Prospective Randomized Study Focused on Understanding the Role of the "Bag Squeeze" to Manage Pain for Patients Undergoing Cystoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Pain Management for Cystoscopy: A Prospective Randomized Study Focused on Understanding the Role of the "Bag Squeeze" to Manage Pain for Patients Undergoing Cystoscopy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether utilization of the "bag squeeze" technique during flexible cystoscopy changes pain scores using a study questionnaire designed by the team which comprises a validated Lingard pain rating scale.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome measure will be assessed for up to 4 hours after consent and completion of clinical procedure.
primary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked to rate their pain on the study-specific Lingard pain scale post-cystocopy. The Lingard pain scale is an outcome measure scaled from 0 (no pain) to 10 (pain as bad it could be). The higher the reported rating out of 10, the more pain the participant has experienced.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive a "bag squeeze" of irrigation fluid (500 ml/~2 cups of %0.9 saline solution) during the insertion of the cystocopy tube during their cystoscopy.
Participants will receive a standard cystoscopy procedure.

intervention.description: Participants will receive a "bag squeeze" of irrigation fluid (500 ml/~2 cups of % 0.9 saline solution) during the insertion of the cystocopy tube during their cystocopy.
Participants will receive a standard cystocopy procedure as per standard of care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male
- Undergoing flexible cystocopy at University Health Network that have undergone a flexible cystocopy and did not demonstrate difficulty during exploration (meatal stenosis or urethral stricture), simultaneous removal or ureteral stents or bladder biopsies or have a chronic history of pelvic pain
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients that do not meet the inclusion criteria.
